verses.text:
Sweet rivers of redeeming love
Lie just before the throne;
And every stream that flows from thence
Makes glad the hearts that mourn.

Those happy souls that have been washed
In the atoning blood,
Walk with their harps about the throne,
And sing the praise of God.

But still their sweetest, loudest song
Is the atoning blood;
The blood that speaks better things than that
Of Abel's sacrifice.

That blood that purchas'd our release,
And wash'd away our stain;
That blood so precious in God's sight,
Was never shed in vain.

Now glory be to God on high,
Glory to God alone;
Glory to God that bought us with
The blood of his dear Son.

O happy souls! O glorious day!
When we shall see his face,
And in his likeness wake above,
Saved by his matchless grace.
